title: Issue 345
summary: You need to check out this MAUI workshop!

items.description:
G'day everyone, welcome to issue #345 of Weekly Xamarin - a wrap-up of the community articles around Xamarin and MAUI communities this week.

It is a fairly slow week in news, but maybe that's because we are so close to a GA release of Maui. Speaking of MAUI and releases, there is a link to a full day self-paced MAUI workshop in this weeks edition, which you should check out.

Have a great week everyone.

❤

Kym

items.title: Interactive Quick Tour in Xamarin Forms/MAUI
items.description:
A quick tour flow allows you to understand what’s an application about and how it works before using it. The most common way is by creating an Onboarding screen (Which is an independent screen that shows some instructive images on how to use the application), but that’s not the only way to do this. This article shows you how to create an interactive quick tour onboarding flow in Xamarin Forms.

Interactive Quick Tour in Xamarin Forms/MAUI by Charlin Agramonte

items.title: .NET MAUI Blazor Hybrid - Custom Authentication Implementation
items.description:
Not all projects will utilize OAuth or Azure AD, and .NET MAUI Blazor Hybrid is no different! This post looks under the covers at how you can implement you own custom solution for authentication within MAUI Blazor and take control of your application without ripping your hair out.

items.title: .NET MAUI Blazor Switch Language In-App
items.description:
You implemented localization on your .NET MAUI app, but are now wondering: how do I switch the language dynamically in app? This video got you covered! We will learn how to show a list of the supported languages, how to switch between the languages and how to persist the configured language with .NET MAUI Essentials.
